channel.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

The one thing good about our model is our economy can explode and go to great heights and outdo the world easily, but when it falls it crashes like hell and there are no cushions and everyone feels it.

the great thing about your country is it has no financial security or stability? dats sum nice logic you got der! in that model though, everyone lower than upper middle class will suffer, you cannot deny that

ps debt and poverty had little to do with the london riots, it was a small contribution sure but once the riots got into swing there’s a little thing called herd mentality which takes over, and it has been pointed out half of the fucking people rioting are using facebook, twitter and their fucking blackberries to communicate, poor people don’t get to have blackberries

pps I was going to get around to replying to you on a few of the “open discussions” we have going but every time I do the posts are usually 2-3 weeks old so ye!

Read full topic

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Therefore I said decent leadership. I wouldn’t count on China having that. As the government could just to the same as the private does now, and build out industry. But if the money is the only problem I would actually like to see something similar with decent leadership to be reborn.

A company would only raise salaries when they have to. And I don’t see how taxing more would do any damage. Warren Buffett said himself that high taxes hadn’t done much damage earlier. Of course not too high.

Read full topic
item.source: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

uhm considering china had to switch to a capitalist economy in order to survive id have to say yes.

The system here is based around the idea that helping the rich will make them more lenient to either raise salaries or hire more people, but greed was never accounted for.

Read full topic

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

There is cushions for the rich. A huge pile of money is very soft. Your system is a very selfish system where the rich steps on the people who made them rich.

A little question if you know, would communism fail if it had a decent leadership, and of course doesn’t give to much in economic help to the poor?

item.source: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Why are you saying Sweden is lucky, doesn’t you mean smart?

The European union is the disaster, as it takes away responsibility from the other states, in hope that rest of the union will fix it. And it takes away freedom from the members. On a local plane, you wouldn’t have the same problems, so saying this is an argument against welfare is unfair to the truth.

The rich would be richer if the country had lower taxes. So how do they get rich because the government played a role?

But I personally would go more even more left, as the best way to control the economy is more state-controlled corporations. Then you don’t need to worry about out-sourcing and giving corporations tax breaks and hope they will create more jobs.

Read full topic
item.source: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Im pretty sure norway has more millionaires than the rest of the world

No, because the richer lifestyle was nice because they didn’t have to work super hard for it because the government played a role. So “why should we work harder because our government spends more?”

Sweden is one of the lucky countries that stuck to the idea of making sure they were exporting approximately the same worth they were importing.

I personally like the European model, but it isn’t long term at all.

Read full topic
item.source: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Look at Sweden, do they have big debt problems?

And if people are getting used to the richer lifestyle, won’t they work to get it back?
PS: Norway has more dollar millionaires per capita than US, so someone here tries to be rich, even though they can’t be mega rich. (Yes, blame the oil, but your argument about nobody will try to get rich is failing).

Read full topic

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

So basically you all link hands and when one person falls you help them from falling all the way down?

And then people get used to that lifestyle as the country slides into debt

Gov has to do something

BOOM LONDON RIOTS

item.title: After a bad week Bomahe and Silabasoft are still theoretically rich
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell: More cash more possibilities. Even if the government would take 30-40% of the money I make, I wouldn’t say no to more. More money could mean nicer house, nicer car (Cars in Norway is really expensive), better food, and could travel more.

And you could still be poor, but you wouldn’t need two jobs to have any chance of surviving.

Read full topic
